home.campaignTitle: Free Indonesian Children and Adolescents from Mental Health Problems.

mission.statement: Adhikti Foundation cares about the fate of children and adolescents in Indonesia, especially on mental and social health issues.

communitySection.title: Community Awareness and Participation
communitySection.introduction: Mental health is not only a medical issue — it is a shared responsibility. Together, we can create supportive environments for children and teenagers to grow safely and confidently.

cards.title: Family Support Systems

mentalHealthIssuesPage.title: Child & Adolescent Mental Health Issues
mentalHealthIssuesPage.introduction: Understanding the mental health challenges faced by the younger generation is the first step toward providing effective support. Let's explore common issues, their causes, and the signs to watch for.

items.name: Anxiety & Stress
items.description: Excessive worry about school, friends, or the future.

items.name: Depression & Sadness
items.description: Persistent feelings of sadness, loss of interest, and low energy.

items.name: Social Issues & Bullying
items.description: Difficulty interacting with peers and the negative impact of bullying.

items.name: Trauma & Pressure
items.description: The impact of difficult events or significant environmental stress.

items.label: Of all mental disorders begin by age 14 (WHO).
Of Indonesian adolescents experience a mental disorder (Basic Health Research 2018).

signs.title: Signs to Watch For
signs.description: Pay attention to significant behavioral changes in your child or teenager:
items: Changes in sleep or eating patterns

cta.text: Knowing the signs is the first step. Let's explore solutions and how to provide support.

solutionsSupportPage.title: Solutions & Support
solutionsSupportPage.introduction: Addressing mental health challenges requires a collective effort. Here are practical approaches we can take as a community, as well as when to seek professional help.

sections.title: Community Initiatives
sections.content: The community is the first line of defense. By organizing workshops, creating safe spaces to share, and empowering peer mentors, we can build a strong and accessible support system.

sections.title: Professional Help
sections.content: Sometimes, expert help is essential. Psychologists, counselors, and medical services can provide proper diagnosis, therapy, and interventions to aid in recovery.

sections.title: Self-Care Tools
sections.content: Encouraging healthy habits can boost mental resilience. Simple activities like mindfulness, journaling, or expressing oneself through art can be a positive outlet.
points: Creative expression through art or music

cta.text: You can be part of the solution. Join us to make a difference.

parentingGuidancePage.title: Guidance for Parents
parentingGuidancePage.introduction: A parent's role is crucial in shaping a child's mental health. Here is a guide to building positive communication, recognizing emotional needs, and supporting your child's growth.

sections.title: Positive Communication
sections.content: Create an environment where your child feels safe to talk about anything. Listen without judgment, validate their feelings, and ask open-ended questions to encourage dialogue.

sections.title: Recognizing Emotional Needs
sections.content: Children express stress and sadness in different ways. Look for behavioral changes, like irritability or withdrawal, as signs they may need emotional support.

sections.title: Building Resilience
sections.content: Help your child develop the ability to bounce back from adversity. Teach problem-solving skills, encourage healthy routines, and celebrate their effort, not just the outcome.

sections.title: When to Seek Professional Help
sections.content: If you are concerned about your child's mental health, do not hesitate to seek help. Signs like extreme or long-lasting behavioral changes are a good reason to consult a professional.
points: Consult with teachers or school counselors

volunteer.title: Become a Volunteer at Adhikti Foundation

faqs.question: Who can become a volunteer?
faqs.answer: Anyone who cares about the mental health of children and adolescents in Indonesia.

faqs.question: How to become a volunteer?
faqs.answer: Click the volunteer registration link or contact us on WhatsApp at 08811094150.

faqs.question: What do volunteers do?
faqs.answer:
• Find sub-volunteers from communities.
• Conduct education with IEC materials.
• Distribute leaflets and activity reports to Adhikti Foundation.

faqs.question: What do volunteers get?
faqs.answer:
• 2.5% of the total funds from sub-volunteers.
• A certificate of appreciation.
• Recommendations for other Adhikti activities.

about.title: About Adhikti Foundation
about.text: Adhikti Foundation (Yayasan Adhirajasa Kusuma Bakti) is a social foundation officially established on May 30, 2022, dedicated to improving the quality of life for children and adolescents in Indonesia.

vision.title: Vision
vision.text: To be a leading organization that understands, protects, and empowers children and adolescents for a brighter future.

mission.title: Mission
mission.text: To realize a decent, healthy, and safe life for every child and adolescent in Indonesia through innovative and sustainable programs.

strategicIssues.title: Strategic Issues 2022–2027
issues: Health of children and adolescents (mental, nutrition, HIV-AIDS).

Youth empowerment and child policy advocacy.

communityActionPage.title: Community Action for Mental Health
communityActionPage.introduction: Everyone can play a role in creating a supportive environment for mental health. Discover how you can get involved, from awareness campaigns to creating safe spaces in your community.

sections.title: Awareness Campaigns
sections.content: Join us in spreading accurate information about mental health. By reducing stigma, we open the door for more people to seek help. Share our materials, host a discussion, or invite us to speak in your community.

sections.title: Create Safe Spaces
sections.content: A safe space is an environment where individuals feel comfortable sharing their experiences without fear of judgment. Learn how to facilitate discussion groups, build peer support networks, and promote empathy in your school, workplace, or neighborhood.

sections.title: Donation Support
sections.content: Your financial support is crucial to the sustainability of our programs. Every donation helps us provide counseling, educational materials, and direct support to children and adolescents in need. See our fund usage transparency.
